articleContent.title: Chord: 13th in A# (Shape: A)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 13th in A# (Shape: A)

## Description
The 13th chord is a complex and rich-sounding chord that adds color and tension to a progression. This particular voicing of the 13th chord is in the key of A# and utilizes the shape of the A major chord.

## Notes and Intervals
- A# (Root)
- C## (Major 3rd)
- E# (Perfect 5th)
- G# (Dominant 7th)
- B# (Major 9th)
- D## (Perfect 11th)
- F## (Major 13th)

## Musical Flavor
The 13th chord in A# adds a jazzy and sophisticated flavor to music. It is often used in jazz, R&B, and soul music to create lush and complex harmonies. The dissonance and color of the 13th chord can bring depth and richness to a musical arrangement.

## Songs
Here are three songs that use the 13th chord in A# (Shape: A):
1. "**So What**" by Miles Davis
2. "**Isn't She Lovely**" by Stevie Wonder
3. "**Cantaloupe Island**" by Herbie Hancock
